item.title: Expressing support for designation of the period beginning on September 21, 2009, and ending on September 25, 2009, as "National Health Information Technology Week".

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Health.

item.title: A resolution designating the week beginning on June 14, 2010, and ending on June 18, 2010, as "National Health Information Technology Week" to recognize the value of health information technology to improving health quality.

latestAction.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S4866; text as passed Senate: CR S4866; text of measure as introduced: CR S4859)

item.text: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent. (consideration: CR S9759; text as passed Senate: CR S9759; text of measure as introduced: CR S9750)

Passed/agreed to in Senate: Submitted in the Senate, considered, and agreed to without amendment and with a preamble by Unanimous Consent.(consideration: CR S9759; text as passed Senate: CR S9759; text of measure as introduced: CR S9750)

summary.text:
Designates September 21-25, 2009, as National Health Information Technology Week.

Recognizes the value of information technology and management systems in transforming health care.

Calls on all stakeholders to promote the use of information technology and management systems to transform the health care system in the United States.

(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)

Designates September 21-25, 2009, as National Health Information Technology Week.

Recognizes the value of information technology and management systems in transforming health care.

Calls on all stakeholders to promote the use of information technology and management systems to transform the health care system in the United States.

bill.title: A resolution expressing support for the designation and goals of "National Health Information Technology Week" for the period beginning on September 21, 2009, and ending on September 25, 2009.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
